title: Why I hate Teemo
body:
He might be able to win lane. but late game he is useless because

a) the opportunity cost of a teemo top is a hard engage tank
b) no true CC (lockdown/stun/knockup/etc) leading to c
c) his only mild cc (shroom slow) relies heavily on baiting through well placed mushrooms which is too hard to coordinate in yoloQ
d) his one good ability in team fights (the blind) can knock out an ADC temporarily but while this means a damage reduction for their team it is temporary and there are no cc effects to lock down the adc so they are free to move out of the damage and return to the fight when the blind wears off - in the meantime the tanks are just soaking up the damage as they are supposed to so their ADC returns to a fight where the opposing team is ability exhausted after throwing everything at the tanks.
e) squishy.
f) does nothing that isn't already covered by mid with rylais and an ADC.
g) immobile - relies on enemies coming to him while invisible or through shroom fields but no chase / lockdown potential.

I'm not saying it cant work - there are some very good teemo players. In the same way a double ADC can work bot lane - it happens and it works from time to time. But more often than not the early lane advantage that 2 damage dealers brings is far outweighed by the mid-late game utility that a tank with CC brings such that dual ADC is "not meta". Or any other "off-meta" pick. It can work, but is it reliable? This is how I feel about Teemo top. Sure, you might be amazing and you might win lane 9 times out of 10. But what is your late game utility in tank meta? What do you actually bring to a team fight that the mid and the adc aren't already bringing? More damage, and a temporary blind. thats it.

Teemo top is completely unreliable and a selfish choice - it is saying "I'm here to win my lane but fuck the rest of the team when it comes to team fights - when we lose the team fights it is because you're bad not because we lack critical utility in our team composition".

Teemo top? Just say no.

replies.body:
Teemo's kit has been very much the same since the start of League and is pretty much outdated by this point.

Ironically, he's labelled as the Swift Scout for his title; yet, he's very immobile. I love Teemo a lot by his design and lore, but I do wish I could play the champ more - though I often do not as he's terrible for teamfights sadly with little utility and short range. He  just needs a proper update really.

I hope he gets reworked into a jungler personally. His theme just seems perfect for the map control and ambush method.

You have never played against a kitemo have you? With kitemo build the asshole is harder to catch than an udyr and does soo much dps but at least his shrooms don't take half your hp away, so I mean that's something.

I main Nasus.

If you ever main Nasus, you will truly hate Teemo as much as I do.

> [{quoted}](name=Miicka,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Fghy8VQK,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-08-04T11:38:08.202+0000)
>
> I main Nasus.
> 
> If you ever main Nasus, you will truly hate Teemo as much as I do.

he is good in lane. he ruins garen and tryn too (i used to play tryn a bit and teemo would ruin me). But this game is much more than laning phase. If you know he is a counter, hug turret, farm as much as you can, and dont throw lane. You may not be able to carry this game, but you can work hard not to throw it.
I feel he is a troll pick doesn't really provide the team with anything

He shuts down his enemy laner, he splitpushes really hard, he should have map control with his shrooms and he can assassinate the adc and run off if he knowns what he's doing and plays the map right. It depends on how you build him I guess and there's really 4 ways he can be built.

Tankmo is surprisingly probably the most selfish build since whilst tanky he doesn't have much peel or damage this way but he's good at laning.
{{item:3110}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3068}} ( {{item:3116}} or  {{item:3027}} ){{item:3026}}{{item:3111}} 

Full AP Burn gives you map control and alot of burst. He's squishy and so you'll need tanks from other roles but with this he's basically a mage.
{{item:3151}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3089}} ( {{item:3285}} or {{item:3165}}  ){{item:3020}}  

Assassin Burst plays like a really mediocre assassin burst assassin but eh. You don't have any escapes really but you are really scary to the enemy adc and your mushrooms still do alot of damage.
{{item:3100}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3020}} 

Atk Speed Shredder/Kitemo Teemo is my favourite teamfight, duelist and splitpush build... tbh it's not great and his range is shorter than most adcs so he's in alot of danger but he can do alot of damage this way and can splitpush really hard if he can get some mushrooms down since they can let him safely outkite anyone that comes to stop him.  This build doesn't work in a number of matchups though and is highly matchup specific since this build will either go really well or really badly depending on the enemy team comp.
{{item:3115}} {{item:3124}} ( {{item:3022}} or {{item:3071}} ) ( {{item:3091}} or {{item:3153}}) {{item:3142}} ( {{item:3006}} or {{item:3009}} )

All of these are top lane builds and whilst you can still run him in the jungle; it's not a good idea but I guess you could build either:
{{item:1419}}  {{item:3153}} {{item:3124}}  {{item:3142}} {{item:3091}} {{item:3006}} as an bursty atk speed assassin
{{item:1402}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3027}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3020}}  as a map control mage

Teemo can do a fair bit and he's very good at keeping some champions in check and helping with map and vision control but he has alot of clear weaknesses and if not played right he's not much help to the team. Kinda depends on the matchup I guess but he's not a trollpick, more a niche one.

I know this because these are all teemo builds I ran back when I was a filthy teemo main when I first started playing league. People aren't joking when they say you can build whatever you want on him but keep in mind you should build with a certain aim in mind. 
If you don't like teemo then yasou, cho'gath, yorrick, tank fizz, tank ekko, gnar, amumu, galio, tahm, ryze, other teemo, gangplank, mundo, jayce, rumble,  swain, urgot and vladimir all counter him for toplane though if you aren't good, teemo may still dick all over you. Also most midlaners beat teemo if anyone is dumb enough to try to bring him midlane. And he's not a good support since he doesn't really have cc or any way to peel short of his blind. He's got drawbacks but he's always fun to pick if the enemy team has a lvl7 master yi or nasus.

> [{quoted}](name=Nightjar,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Fghy8VQK,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-04T13:14:16.191+0000)
>
> I know this because these are all teemo builds I ran back when I was a filthy teemo main when I first started playing league. People aren't joking when they say you can build whatever you want on him but keep in mind you should build with a certain aim in mind. 
> If you don't like teemo then yasou, cho'gath, yorrick, tank fizz, tank ekko, gnar, amumu, galio, tahm, ryze, other teemo, gangplank, mundo, jayce, rumble,  swain, urgot and vladimir all counter him for toplane though if you aren't good, teemo may still dick all over you. Also most midlaners beat teemo if anyone is dumb enough to try to bring him midlane. And he's not a good support since he doesn't really have cc or any way to peel short of his blind. He's got drawbacks but he's always fun to pick if the enemy team has a lvl7 master yi or nasus.

I dont hate facing teemo. I hate the fact that in about 50% of my games this week some mlg wannabe has taken teemo top against the request of their team,  won their lane then thrown the game. I ban him now so that nobody on my team can pick him.

I feel if a teemo doesn't push towers and focuses on objective control he's not doing it right. Teemo isn't a good pick atm since he doesn't really provide the things most top laners need to be doing in this meta and I agree that alot of teemo's will win lane and then not really do anything, whereas they should be pushing down towers and putting alot of pressure top or put shrooms down to clear waves and then roam and try to get dragon or towers in other lanes. If he doesn't do this and just stays top and bullies the enemy top laner he's kinda useless since in teamfights he isn't all that useful or reliable.

He sits in brush till people are low or a squishy walks past. Effectively makes the game 4v5. 
If you're smart and bait him out his blind stops 1 person while another picks him off. 
He can dump shrooms over the whole map to the point you can't move. You get slowed for ages so even theoretically if you were some how tanky enough to survive the poison you're not going anywhere fast anyway. 
It's fun for the person who plays it if you get fed because no one can touch you. Everyone else is just hating life on both sides having to deal with such a trashy champion.
He is literally the Donald Trump of League.

- I think Teemo probably isn't a meta top lane pick right now, he has a few counters that are really hard to beat. However if you are playing him correctly or building him correctly and pretty much doing as nightjar said then you won't be useless late game. 

- What I do when I play Teemo is focus on winning lane then split pushing and creating alot of map pressure (Usually they have to send 2 or 3 people to deal with me split pushing) or securing objectives with the team (Baron/Drag/Towers). 

- I also think if you are going to play Teemo top you need to have some kind of tank on your team, support or jungle usually has to fill that role.

- AP Teemo is pretty busted at higher elo, in low elo its fine to play. I find at higher elo you are going to run into enemy teams that just build 3 - 5 upgraded orcacles if you are an AP fed Teemo. A better way to build Teemo in my opinion is the is AD mallet build.

[{quoted}](name=Nightjar,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=Fghy8VQK,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-04T23:42:10.478+0000)>
> I feel if a teemo doesn't push towers and focuses on objective control he's not doing it right. Teemo isn't a good pick atm since he doesn't really provide the things most top laners need to be doing in this meta and I agree that alot of teemo's will win lane and then not really do anything, whereas they should be pushing down towers and putting alot of pressure top or put shrooms down to clear waves and then roam and try to get dragon or towers in other lanes. If he doesn't do this and just stays top and bullies the enemy top laner he's kinda useless since in teamfights he isn't all that useful or reliable.

I agree with this. Teemo is a bitch to vs, but in a ranked game, id so much rather he was on the enemy team than mine.

Whenever I'm in ranked champion select, and our support has picked someone like Nami or Janna, our jungle picks Shaco, and then top lane is like "Oh look its a Nasus, I'm gunna pick Teemo so i can wreck!" and me (mid) and the ADC just look at eachother and think:
_"Sooo.. uhhh.. shall i build tank, or will you?"_

Teemo is hilariously fun to play (especially with his omega squad skin... infact.. ONLY with his omega squad skin) but like you say, you sacrifice too much utility. if top feels the need to go squishy instead of tank, Id at least rather have a Quinn top, at least she has some CC and good map control, and unlike Teemo she can at least stand a chance at killing a tank.

Yeah teemo is a good counterpick to nasus but maybe not the best pick in that situation. If he does go that way then he better be pushing hard and trying to close the game as early as possible (which is possible I mean you already have a shaco, get a few early game champs and try to win as fast as possible). All in all though he would have been better off picking, cho'gath, darius, jax, malphite, sion or even tryndamere or pantheon (cause even though they aren't true tanks, if you want to push towers and end early you might as well do it properly).
Teemo has a niche but yeah he's not a great pick; especially if he doesn't understand map control, siege-ing and splitpushing. If the enemy team had say a squishy assassin stealth jungler like rengar, a nasus and an aa adc (not a caster adc like corki or lucian) then I would say his pick is justified though.

He literally get decimated by any form of cc and or burst, sure if you're fed and ahead he has potential but what champ doesn't, there is just far too many champs who are above him, wouldn't even rate him 3rd tier
